availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. Keller (Kentucky resident and solider. Confederate guerrilla)

body.p: Kentucky resident and solider. Served in the Kentucky 8th Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a private, mustered in September 10, 1862, deserted October 4, 1862. Formed a guerilla group with J. Miller with whom he murdered Major Abraham G. Wileman (U.S.A.) on October 5, 1863. Murdered in retribution by William Watkins on October 20, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0045.
"Jim Kellar," _ Louisville Journal_ (Louisville, KY), October 26, 1863, p. 1.
"Major Wileman's Murderers Captured,"Louisville Journal(Louisville, KY), October 20, 1863, p.1.
